summary: Code imports subprocess and executes an 'ls -l' command, captures output in stdout and error in stderr, then prints both.

details.comment: Code imports subprocess and executes an 'ls -l' command, captures output in stdout and error in stderr, then prints both.
details.content:
import subprocess
# import subprocess
out = subprocess.Popen(['ls', '-l'],
           stdout=subprocess.PIPE,
           stderr=subprocess.STDOUT)
stdout,stderr = out.communicate()
print(stdout)
print(stderr)
